course_title: Special Topics: Human Health: Writing Bodies
class_notes: This class studies the relation between embodiment and writing: how do our bodies shape the way we write and how do we tell effective stories about the body? We'll carefully study several fictional masterpieces about various bodily states: illness, dying, disability, pregnancy, aging, pleasure, pain, etc. Students will also be expected to produce their own fictional narrative which we will workshop together in class. (Permission Only; reach out to Ms. Shiyra Sadoff in Human Health to apply)
course_description: Seminar of lecture series of topics in human health. May be repeated for credit when topic varies. Credit varies from one to five hours.
schedule_location: MW 1pm-2:15pm in Emerson Chemistry Bldg. E504
